message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.IT 

This paper discusses the vulnerabilities and security issues related to the Controller Area Network (CAN) protocol used in Electronic Control Units (ECUs) of vehicles. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also proposes hardware-based Intrusion Response Systems (IRSs) to defend against attacks, which falls under the category of cs.SY (Systems and Control). The use of in-vehicle network protocols such as CAN is related to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of extra wires to measure voltages of the CAN bus lines, which is related to cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper proposes a solution to mitigate the vulnerabilities of voltage-based Intrusion Detection Systems (IDSs), which is related to cs.IT (Information Theory).
